boardgame.name: 20 Hallucinations 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

From time to time you will find a player character having a hallucination or two. Sometimes it's from bad liquor or a drug slipped into their food, other times its the result of a magical spell, the spores of a toxic cave fungus, or the side affect of a foul monster's venom. Regardless of the cause, the player is likely to want to know exactly what the hallucination is like.
This product contains twenty brief but adequately detailed hallucinations for the GM to quickly roll up and use. Some hallucinations may cause audible and/or visual delusions, others may affect taste, smell, and touch. Many of the delirious delusions in this product affect multiple senses at once.
Twenty Hallucinations is carefully designed to work with any role playing game setting, from fantasy to sci-fi to modern to historical.

boardgame.name: tverek
boardgame.description: tveráek is a satirical improvisation card party game for four or more players. It is played on individual rounds, so-called "term of office". In each term of office, one player is the president (of Czech Republic), player on his or her left is the president's spokesperson and all others are journalist. The President chooses the subject of speech and, after playing the cards (statements) he/she must use them in a speech. Journalists then ask unnecessary and provocative additional questions to which the spokesperson must react promptly, even if they are far from being worthy. If his responses gets journalists offended, they give him points of shame. When a journalist buzzes, the spokesperson is satisfied. Goal of the game is gain as many points of shame as possible.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Runners
boardgame.description:
You and your friends play as one of six heroes and navigate an ever changing dungeon. Triumph over encounters to earn treasure or test your luck with Quests to earn Epic Treasure! Find the key to unlock the boss door, and prepare yourselves for an epic battle against one of six unique creatures of darkness.

Dungeon Runners is a board game designed to introduce new players to table top fantasy games without being too overwhelming, but while still maintaining a fun experience for hobbyist players. There are 3 different play lengths, a short game, mid game, or long game. The board is modular, so each run will be unique each time you play.

Single Player: For a single player campaign, the player takes control of 2 heroes.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Trinkets - Bottles
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bottles are everywhere, from the flask of whisky strapped to your saddle to the delicate vials that hold your healing potions, looted from the shelves of a long-abandoned alchemical lab or found floating against the rocks on the shore.

GMs often struggle to come up with new and interesting ways to make bottles and their contents interesting, falling back on "it's just a bottle". We aim to fix that. Trinkets - Bottles is intended to inject more detailed descriptions, variety and flavour into your RPG worlds. The tables you'll find inside this book are system-agnostic, but work most easily in a fantasy setting.

Inside this download you will find:

tables for generating new and unique bottles that your players will treasure
more unusual types of storage devices from barrels to dead creatures
over 80 pre-built ideas for bottles ready to drop straight into your game
adventure hooks, NPCs, and new locations to help you introduce these weird bottles to your world

Publisher's blurb:

Every modern day setting needs people… even common average ones in the background. Though sometimes the assumed gender and a name might be enough, the players are usually going to want to know more. This set of 50 folks delivers just that. Each roll of the die reveals the first and last name of a person as well as their age. After that, there’s a brief description– often this description will indicate their occupation and/or what they are currently doing with their lives. Sometimes the information gets a bit more interesting.

boardgame.name: 50 Motivators for Fantasy Characters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The fantasy/sword and sorcery flavored edition of Fishwife Games’ 50 motivators lists. From simple peasant to mighty hero to ruler of the land, all folks are motivated by some sense of gain, goal, or purpose. Is the individual in search of wealth and power or they in fact hiding from someone or some dark past. Do they seek to discover the hidden or gain knowledge about the unknown? Are they simply driven by baser aspects, such as bloodlust, lecherous cravings, or jealousy? Is the individual just simply trying to stay alive and get enough food in their gut to see another day? Use the percentile dice to quickly roll up the motivations of the non-player characters that the heroes may run into on their campaign quests.

boardgame.name: 50 Motivators for Wasteland Survivors
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Living in a ruined world after the collapse of society can take its toll on someone. Survivors need more than just physical ability and a supply of resources. They also need a desire to keep going. So what makes a particular survivor tick? What’s their goals, desires, or reason to keep going? This list provides 50 different possible motivators for the GM to roll up for non-player characters as needed. The list is also good for a player who hasn’t quite decided on the angle or driving urge for their own character. The list is also perfectly fine for a zombie apocalypse game as well as any campaign world where folks are wandering about in an effort to stay alive and have needs met.

boardgame.name: 50 Ships of the Harbor
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This detailed list of pirate era style sailing ships provides a wealth of information for the GM needing to quickly fill up that harbor full of vessels waiting to be challenged, exploited, or cautiously avoided. Included in the notes are the following details: ship name and type (galleon, dogger, sloop, barque, etc.), the captain’s name and official title (as in captain, major, commodore, admiral, etc.), and a brief detailing of important cargo and passengers. In addition, the GM may find other treats listed in the cargo notes, including the occasional treasure map, stolen jewels of the crown, etc.

boardgame.name: 50 Wasteland Caravan Haulers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the days after the fall of civilization the highways, interstates, and primary roads are still active with the presence of drivers. Many of these travelers are post modern caravan haulers, daring the marauders, mutant beasts, and assorted hazards to deliver much sought after goods and supplies to survivor settlements. This random list provides 50 of such examples. Included in each entry is the driver name, the type of vehicle they are using, and the most important goods that they are carrying. The GM is free to add to or otherwise modify this list of hauled supplies as desired. Need a few supply laden victims for that crew of highway marauders? Use this chart! Want to add an adventure hook to the campaign centered around a settlement waiting on much needed cargo? Use this chart! Just need to fill up the highways? Use this chart!

boardgame.name: 50 Wasteland Swap Meet Vendors
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the days after civilization the once proud department store chains, grocery stores, and other big retail outlets are replaced by loose, flea market style vendors looking to trade the assorted merchandise and goods that they have scavenged from the ruins. This list provides 50 of such vendors along with the most important items that they have for sale. The GM should feel free to house these vendors anywhere they choose, from merely hawking goods from the backs of vehicles in an old parking lot to being huddled up in a dark and dreary abandoned warehouse. Though intended for use in post apocalypse game settings, this list may also be useful as a list of modern day flea market vendors with a wee bit of tweaking.
